Package org.ginsim.core.graph

Interface GraphBackend<V,​E extends Edge<V>>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - vertex
    E - edge
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JgraphtBackendImpl
    public interface GraphBackend<V,​E extends Edge<V>>
    Abstract definition of a graph backend to avoid leaking implementation details in the main classes.
    Author:
    Lionel Spinelli, Aurelien Naldi

    • Method Detail

      • addNodeInBackend

        boolean addNodeInBackend​(V node)
        Add a node to the graph. The front-end graph is responsible for creating the node object and calling this method in the backend.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        true if the node was created, false otherwise

      • addEdgeInBackend

        boolean addEdgeInBackend​(E edge)
        Add an edge to the graph. The front-end graph is responsible for creating the edge and calling this method in the backend.
        Parameters:
        edge -
        Returns:
        true if the edge was created, false otherwise

      • containsNode

        boolean containsNode​(V node)
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        true if the node is in the graph, false if not.

      • getExistingNode

        V getExistingNode​(V node)
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        an existing node if found, or null.

      • containsEdge

        boolean containsEdge​(V from,
                     V to)
        Parameters:
        from -
        to -
        Returns:
        true if an edge between the two provided vertices exists in the graph, false if not.

        boolean removeNode​(V node)
        remove a node from the graph.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the node was correctly removed, false if not.

        V getNodeByName​(String id)
        Give access to the node named with the given name

        Returns:

      • getEdgeViewInfo

        EdgeViewInfo<V,​E> getEdgeViewInfo​(E edge)
        Get raw view information for an edge. This may return null if the edge has no attached information.
        Parameters:
        edge -
        Returns:
        the raw view information for this edge

      • getShortestPath

        List<E> getShortestPath​(V source,
                        V target)
        Find the shortest path between the two given vertices
        Parameters:
        source - the node at the beginning of the searched path
        target - the node at the end of the searched path
        Returns:
        the list of edges composing the shortest path
